intro: Hieracium fulvoluteum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are surrounded by pale green bracts. Hieracium fulvoluteum is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, making it a common sight in various natural and semi-natural environments.
